title: I've been spamming ARURF for the last six hours, waiting to have fun
body:
And yet, every game, someone has to flame their team, or screech at the enemy team, or we get shit champions and stomped, or one or more people are AFK, or people ragequit, or the enemy team surrenders for no apparent reason while winning (happened twice), all while people detonate in one second, which isn't actually fun for either party.

I like freely casting my abilities, but it doesn't seem to be enough to make the game fun. Keep in mind that I played the original URF basically all day every day because I was having a blast.

replies.body:
Just had a match where we went 38-6 in under ten minutes (I was 9/1, with the 1 being an execute after a kill under turret), and yet all I feel is mild discomfort. We were five ranged champs against four melee and an ADC. I spent the match spamming Kai'Sa W at Rengar and Shyvana, who basically couldn't be within two screens of me... and if they approached, I would add Q and they would die faster. Plus, the Illaoi laning with me would've punished an all-in.

The enemy team's flame spilled over into /all after a few minutes of dying. I don't know what their comp could've done against our comp. It was like being handed a win. And it upset the enemy team, most of whom probably reported each other. I disliked being on the winning side of this less than I would've disliked being on the losing side, but I still didn't enjoy it.

And it upset the enemy team, most of whom probably reported each other. I disliked being on the winning side of this less than I would've disliked being on the losing side, but I still didn't enjoy it.

It's like 5 rocks vs 5 scissors. 
Then again, if you reroll, or swap with people, you can get an "adequate" champion with range (Since that seems to be the only good way of accomplishing anything in this mode).

It seems like every game starts with everyone trying to cheese top, even if you don't have a good comp for it. Had a team with 3 adcs (including myself), a Vi, and an Amumu who built tank. 

I said don't go top since they had a Morg, Lux, Neeko, Zed (and something else I dont remember)... 3 of them ignored me and all ran top to int. 

Proceeded to ?????????????????????????? me since I stayed botlane (the twitch who originally went mid moved top to help but ran off since they all died).

Followed by flaming, the tank Amumu constantly pinging my build since I built Bloodthirster before Infinity Edge (my kda was way higher than his), the Vi telling everyone to report me for trolling ( her kda was slightly better) and Jhin spamming ??? (he was like 2/11). The Twitch was ok though.

Fun times, especially since the Vi jungle said "not ganking u cait." left me to 2v1 against Morg and Zed for a good portion of the game.

I'm bored enough to be doing it again right now. "--ssies"... "small brain team"... "I WANTED TEEMO U ----SUCKER, I'M FEEDING /all OPEN BOT FREE KILLS"... Whether we win (AFK on enemy team) or lose (team decides to hate each other because reasons), I'm seeing why toxicity is such a popular issue. I only see this kind of behavior once or twice in a year in co-op, but it's been just about every game in PvP.
